AT&T CEO John Stankey (sorry, Stany) just gave employees a masterclass in corporate word vomit. After 99,000 employees filled out a survey hoping for improvements, they got a 2,000-word sermon about why they’re wrong and why “market-based culture” means bye-bye perks, hello cubicles.

In this video, I break down how CEOs like John Stankey talk in endless loops of jargon — penetration, churn, synergy, autonomy, machine vision — without saying anything real. If you’ve ever sat through a company all-hands and wondered, “what the hell did that even mean?” — this one’s for you.
title: CEO WORD VOMITS ABOUT RTO (AT&T)
